  <div class="panel-section">
    <h2 class="panel-title">Panel 1: Uncertainty in Public Policy</h2>
    
<div class="panel-summary">
      <p>This panel brings together leading experts to discuss the critical role of uncertainty in public policy decision-making. Panelists will explore how governments and policymakers can better incorporate probabilistic thinking, risk assessment, and scenario planning into policy design. Topics include communicating uncertainty to the public, navigating political constraints when dealing with uncertain information, and case studies from healthcare, climate policy, and economic forecasting.</p>

    <h2 class="panel-title">Panel 2: AI and Uncertainty Quantification</h2>

<div class="panel-summary">
      <p>As artificial intelligence systems become increasingly prevalent in high-stakes decision-making, understanding and quantifying their uncertainty is crucial. This panel examines the challenges and opportunities in building AI systems that can express confidence levels, handle ambiguous inputs, and provide reliable uncertainty estimates. Experts will discuss techniques from Bayesian deep learning, conformal prediction, ensemble methods, and explainable AI, along with practical applications in autonomous systems, medical diagnosis, and financial modeling.</p>
